sense.name: Strike or drive against with a heavy impact.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Agent may be destroyed or damaged by impact.
sense.examples: The killer rammed against the gate with a sledgehammer. We rammed on the door as hard as possible. The car rammed into the lightpost.

sense.name: Force into or from an action or state, either physical or metaphorical.
sense.examples: She rammed her mind into focus. I rammed the project into Phase 2.

sense.name: RAM DOWN: Strike or drive against with heavy impact, displacing the object rammed down.
sense.examples: We rammed down the door and gained entry.

sense.name: RAM HOME: make clear by special emphasis and try to convince somebody of something.
sense.examples: I thought I rammed home that point earlier in the discussion. The instructor always tries to ram home a few basic ideas each lecture.

sense.name: Crowd or pack into, possibly to capacity.
sense.examples: The company is ramming into a smaller headquarters.

sense.name: RAM HOME: teach by drills and repetion.
sense.commentary: NOTE: Compare to Sense 4: In Sense 6, repetition is implied whereas in Sense 4, implication is only of emphasis.
sense.examples: Sergeants ram home the message through repetition.
